intro: Lappula saphronovae, commonly known as the Central Asian lappula, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and edible seeds. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Lappula saphronovae is often found growing in sandy soils and along the edges of deserts.
